program_details.description: The Asian Development Scholarship funds around 300 students from Asia and Pacific countries to pursue Master’s Degree programs in the universities specified by the ADB located in 9 countries.

program_details.description: Multiple Indonesian universities offer fully funded scholarships for international students to pursue Bachelor, Master, and PhD degrees.

The Burger King Scholarship is an initiative of the Burger King McLamore Foundation, named after the company’s co-founder, James W. McLamore. The scholarship focuses on supporting employees, their spouses, and children, as well as high school seniors in the pursuit of higher education.

conditions: Applicants must be living in the U.S.A., Canada, OR Puerto Rico.

academic_requirements: Applicants must be graduating high school seniors.
Applicants must plan to enroll in an accredited two- or four-year college, university, or vocational-technical school.

employment_status: Employees of Burger King, their spouses or domestic partners, and their children are eligible to apply.

application_process: Visit the Scholarship Website
Create an Account
Complete the Application Form
Upload Required Documents
Write and Submit a Personal Statement
Submit Letters of Recommendation
Review and Submit
Confirmation

basic_info.title: Thailand Chulalongkorn University Graduate Scholarship 2025 (Fully Funded)
basic_info.author: Muhammad Saim Rasheed

funding_type.details: Covers tuition fees, a monthly stipend, accommodation, and airfare.

program_details.description: The Chulalongkorn University Graduate Scholarship 2025 is a fully funded scholarship open to ASEAN and NON-ASEAN students for Master's and Doctoral degrees.

conditions: For students from ASEAN, the airfare must not exceed 8,500 Baht
For students from Asian countries, the airfare must not exceed 12,000 Baht
For students from Europe, Australia, and New Zealand as well as Africa, the airfare must not exceed 20,000 Baht.
For students from North and South America, the airfare must not exceed 30,000 Baht.

academic_requirements: Applicants must have completed a Bachelor’s degree if applying for a Master’s degree.
Applicants must have completed a Bachelor’s and Master’s Degree if applying for a Doctoral program.

specific_conditions: Applicants must be in good health.

submission_method.instructions: Refer to the provided PDF document for application instructions.

general: An academic transcript issued by the last academic institution that the applicant attended.
A certificate of graduation, if available.
A photocopy of the applicant’s passport.

funding_type.details: Financial aid for students in classes 9 to 12

program_details.description: Scholarship for students of classes 9 to 12 in Gujarat, India.

academic_requirements: Must be a student of classes 9 to 12.
Must have good marks in their previous exam.
Must obtain excellent marks in the entrance exam.

other_restrictions: The student’s family income should be below than INR 150,000 per annum.
The applicant must be a student of Govt. recognized insitute.

submission_method.instructions: Submit online application and send printed form with documents to District Education Officer.

general: Marksheets and certificates of previous academic qualifications.
Proof of family income issued by a competent authority.
Aadhaar card, voter ID, or any other government-issued ID.
Ration card, utility bills, or any other document as proof of residence.
Bank passbook or cancelled cheque for direct benefit transfer.

application_process: Go to the Gujarat State Examination Board website.
Click on the Gyan Sadhana Scholarship link.
Enter the U-DISE number and press the “SUBMIT” button.
Fill in the details correctly that are required.
Attach the required verified documents and click the “Submit” button.
Print out the application form and send it with documents to the concerned District Education Officer.
Download the admit card before going for the exam.

funded_by.primary: Mexican Agency for International Development Cooperation (AMEXCID)

participating_universities: More than 90 Mexican higher education institutes

nationality.type: Open to citizens of more than 180 countries

other_languages.details: Proof of advanced knowledge of the Spanish language

return_obligations.details: Letter of commitment to return to the country of origin

other_restrictions: Applicants currently not living in Mexico

general: Letter detailing reasons for study in Mexico
Letter of academic acceptance from Mexican institution
Letter of commitment to return to country of origin
Letter of acceptance of the terms of the Call
Copy of valid passport or government-issued photo ID
Proof of advanced knowledge of Spanish language
Letter stating that the information provided is true

additional_instructions: Use Google Translator to translate the application guidelines and other files into English.

program_details.description: The Open Doors Scholarship is Funded by the Russian Government. It is a Single application process and the winners of this scholarship are granted free admission to a Russian University. The Moscow Polytechnic University also comes under the Open Doors Scholarship Project.

funding_type.details: covers all the expenses including airfare, tuition, accommodation, and stipend

program_details.description: This International Higher Educational scholarship program offers 29 programs in 2024 with 23 partner universities. You can apply for the undergraduate, master’s, and PhD Degree programs in cooperation with renowned partner universities in Taiwan.

tuition.details: The TaiwanICDF will cover the tuition fee as required by the student’s university.

masters.details: per month for Food and living expenses.

phd.details: per month for Food and living expenses.

travel.details: Most direct flights to and from Taiwan with Economy Class tickets

coverage_details: Insurance fees will be covered for the entire duration of the program

excluded_nationalities: national of the Republic of China (Taiwan)
conditions: Must be a citizen of a country listed in the eligible countries by ICDF.

other_restrictions: Upon accepting a TaiwanICDF scholarship, do not hold any other ROC (Taiwan) government-sponsored scholarship.

selection_process.notification_process: The list of successful applicants will be informed by 10th June 2024.

application_process: Complete the online application before March 15, 2024.
Complete and submit the requested admission documents before the admissions deadline of the TaiwanICDF scholarship partner universities.
Submit necessary documents to the ROC (Taiwan) Embassy or Representative Office in your country.
After a review of a list of recommended applicants to the TaiwanICDF.
The list of successful applicants will be informed by 10th June 2024.
In addition to the TaiwanICDF application, candidates must apply separately to their chosen universities and meet their specific requirements.
